text: Zelle is a service that lets you
digitally transfer money free of charge.

We're going to show
you how to get started,
send and receive money,
and also how to request money.

Many banks use Zelle
within their banking apps.
We're using Capital One,
and here's how it works for us.
If your bank is not a partner with Zelle,
you can use Zelle's stand-alone app
to send and receive money.
Use the clickable sections below

to skip to different
parts of this tutorial.
When you first open the app,
you'll be asked to search for your bank.
Once it's located,
you'll need to give Zelle permission
to link your bank account to the app.
Now log in to your bank account online.
Make sure you read the fine print
before clicking "Agree."
To send money on Zelle,
both the sender and receiver
must have Zelle accounts.

Tap "Send Money with
Zelle" on the main screen
and then "Send Money" from the pop-up.
Scroll through your mobile contacts

and find the person you
want to send money to.

Alternatively, you can search
for them in the search bar.
Click on their name.

Click "Yes" to confirm you've
selected the right contact.
Type the amount of money you wish to send.
Tap "Review" when you're finished.
If you wish, you can type a reason

for sending the money to
this particular person.
Once you're ready to make the payment,
"Slide to Send."
Tap "Yes" to complete the process.
To request an amount from someone,
tap on "Send Money with Zelle."

Then select "Request
Money" from the pop-up.

Select them from your
contacts and select an amount.
Tap "Review."

You can add a note to add
a transaction description.
Now "Slide to Request."

You'll be notified when
the person pays you
your requested amount.
